## Using VS Writing typst in Quarto

- **Use typst with Quarto**: You can use typst with Quarto to generate PDFs. You have a [bunch of options](https://quarto.org/docs/output-formats/typst.html), but if you want to build a template with all your branding / advanced custom style, you'll create a quarto typst custom format, which is very different.

- **Create a Quarto typst custom format**:

## Initialize the project

Run:

```bash
quarto create extension format
```

Then you'll have:

```
my_extension_name/
├── template.qmd                # Default Quarto file when someone use your template
└── _extensions/
    └── my_extension_name/
        ├── _extension.yml      # Metadata for the extension
        ├── typst-show.typ      # Layer between quarto and typst core file
        └── typst-template.typ  # Where you'll write most typst code
```

## Workflow

- Use either VS Code or Positron (RStudio does not support typst)
- Install the following VSCode/Positron extensions:
  - [Typst LSP](https://open-vsx.org/extension/nvarner/typst-lsp)
  - [Tinymist Typst](https://open-vsx.org/extension/myriad-dreamin/tinymist)
  - [vscode-pdf](https://open-vsx.org/extension/tomoki1207/pdf)

## Communicate between Quarto and Typst files

- quarto YAML --> `typst-show.typ` --> `typst-template.typ`
